name: Chronic Systemic Inflammatory Response Syndrome (CSIRS)
chief_complaint: I feel exhausted all the time, have constant low-grade fevers, and my joints ache
prognosis: Variable; condition often follows chronic course with periods of remission and exacerbation. Early intervention improves long-term outcomes.
description: CSIRS is a state of chronic, low-grade systemic inflammation without clear infectious or autoimmune etiology. It represents a dysregulated immune response potentially triggered by environmental factors, chronic stress, or metabolic dysfunction. The condition shares features with chronic fatigue syndrome and fibromyalgia but is distinguished by specific inflammatory markers.
